verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <S%H5329><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> How long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H575><s%> wilt thou forget <S%H7911><s%> me, O LORD? <S%H3068><s%> forever? <S%H5331><s%> how long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H575><s%> wilt thou hide <S%H5641><s%> <S%H853><s%> thy face <S%H6440><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> me?

How long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H575><s%> shall I take <S%H7896><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%> in my soul, <S%H5315><s%> having sorrow <S%H3015><s%> in my heart <S%H3824><s%> daily? <S%H3119><s%> how long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H575><s%> shall mine enemy <S%H341><s%> be exalted <S%H7311><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> me?

Consider <S%H5027><s%> and hear <S%H6030><s%> me, O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God: <S%H430><s%> lighten <S%H215><s%> mine eyes, <S%H5869><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> I sleep <S%H3462><s%> the sleep of death; <S%H4194><s%>

Lest <S%H6435><s%> mine enemy <S%H341><s%> say, <S%H559><s%> I have prevailed against <S%H3201><s%> him; and those that trouble <S%H6862><s%> me rejoice <S%H1523><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> I am moved. <S%H4131><s%>
But I <S%H589><s%> have trusted <S%H982><s%> in thy mercy; <S%H2617><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> shall rejoice <S%H1523><s%> in thy salvation. <S%H3444><s%>
I will sing <S%H7891><s%> unto the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> he hath dealt bountifully <S%H1580><s%> with <S%H5921><s%> me.
